title: Britain's worst rugby team refuse to throw in towel after 240-0 defeat
text:

Britain's worst rugby team entered the record books for all the wrong reasons after slumping to a 240-0 defeat.

South Leicester RFC conceded 36 tries - averaging three points a minute - in the rout by league rivals Bromsgrove.

They have conceded 100 points in all but one of their seven games, including 119-0, 120-0 and 127-7 losses.

Despite being left red-faced on the pitch, the team have been praised for even turning up for games.

Every first-team player left the club in the summer after relegation from National League two.

They have lost their main sponsor, which has left bosses unable to pay their reserve team.

Against Bromsgrove they lost two players to injury and had to continue with only 13 due to league rules.

(Image: Google)

Bromsgrove coach Dan Protherough described last week’s match in Worcestershire as a “surreal experience”.

He praised his team for “not taking their foot off the gas” but said he had sympathy for South Leicester.

“South Leicester kept going be fair to them. You can only beat what's in front of you,” he added.

"It was a tricky scenario as you feel for the opposition but you have to get the victory.”

The winning side tweeted: “Massive respect for @SouthRfc coming today, cannot be nice feeling like this week in week out.”

South Leicester replied: “When you lose an entire squad overnight pre-season this is the result.

“We understand this was a terrible result but South are committed to continuing to build a side that can compete and offer meaningful fixtures going forward.

“South have experienced a torrid time so far this season and acknowledge that we are being outgunned and have failed to match the physicality of this division.

“We are committed to building a squad so our proud club can then play the type of rugby everyone deserves to see.”

The biggest defeat in a rugby fixture came when Belgian side Royal Katuro beat Soignes 356-3 in 2015.
description: South Leicester RFC conceded 36 tries in their record defeat to league rivals Bromsgrove.
